question: For mala in se crimes, criminal intent (mens rea) is generally immaterial; the mere commission of the prohibited act is sufficient for punishment.
A "bill of attainder" is a legislative act that retroactively increases the penalty for a crime already committed.
The People v. Wong Cheng case affirmed that crimes committed onboard foreign vessels docked in Philippine waters generally fall under Philippine jurisdiction.
In an "attempted" felony, the offender has already performed all the acts of execution that would produce the felony.
An "impossible crime" is punished because the means employed were adequate but the object of the crime did not exist.
The "General" characteristic of Philippine Criminal Law means it applies only to Filipino citizens within Philippine jurisdiction.
Once conspiracy is proven, all conspirators are held equally liable for the crime actually committed, regardless of their individual roles in the execution.
The People v. Simon case reiterated that drug offenses are generally mala prohibita, meaning the intent to commit the crime is irrelevant.
A felony is "frustrated" when the offender performs all the acts of execution, but the crime is not completed due to causes independent of his will.
The principle of "Prospective (Non-Retroactivity)" in criminal law allows new laws to be applied to acts committed before their enactment, even if unfavorable to the accused.
In a criminal conspiracy, once proven, the act of one is considered the act of:
choices: The person who directly committed the physical act.
All conspirators, holding them equally liable.

question: Criminal law in the Philippines is primarily governed by:
Which of the following scenarios best describes an "impossible crime" due to factual impossibility?
choices: Shooting a dead person with intent to kill.
Trying to pickpocket an empty pocket.
Attempting to commit a crime that is not legally defined.

question: "Self-defense" is categorized under which type of circumstance in criminal law?
Crimes that are inherently evil or immoral by their nature, requiring proof of criminal intent (mens rea), are classified as:
The exception to the non-retroactivity of criminal laws, allowing a new law to be applied to past acts, applies when the new law is:
For "insanity" to be an exempting circumstance, it must be proven that the accused:
choices: Was completely deprived of intelligence or discernment at the very moment the crime was committed.
Was under the influence of drugs.
Had a history of mental health issues.
Was merely suffering from a mental illness at the time of the crime.

question: The People v. Simon case, involving illegal drug sale, reaffirmed that drug offenses are generally:
choices: Trying to pickpocket an empty pocket.
Attempting to commit a crime that is not legally defined.
Shooting a dead person with intent to kill.

question: A felony is "frustrated" when:
choices: The offender spontaneously desists from continuing the crime.
All elements necessary for its execution and accomplishment are present.
The offender begins the commission of the crime by overt acts but does not perform all acts of execution.
The offender performs all acts of execution, but the crime is not completed due to causes independent of his will.

question: A person who, having knowledge of the commission of the crime, conceals or assists in the escape of the principal after the crime, is classified as a/an:
